alert.note: Alert for Anderson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 3:04PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST/8 PM CST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...All of southern Indiana and much of central Kentucky. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EST /800 PM CST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 302 PM EST /202 PM CST/, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Louisville, Elizabethtown, Frankfort, Jeffersonville, New Albany, Jeffersontown, St. Matthews, Shively, Jasper and Shelbyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
